snippet: The Supreme Court indicated that it might review a Unocal Corporation patent for cleaner-burning gasoline, asking the Justice Department for input on an appeal by five rival oil companies. Hundreds of millions of dollars are at stake.    The Exxon...
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court indicated that it might review a Unocal Corporation patent for cleaner-burning gasoline, asking the Justice Department for input on an appeal by five rival oil companies. Hundreds of millions of dollars are at stake. The Exxon Mobil Corporation and four other companies say Unocal's patent is invalid because it was designed to mirror California clean-fuel requirements, forcing other refiners to pay simply for abiding by the state's rules.
abstract: Supreme Court indicates that it may review Unocal Corp patent for cleaner-burning gasoline, asking Justice Department for input on an appeal by five rival oil companies; Exxon Mobil Corp and four other companies say Unocal's patent is invalid because it is designed to mirror California clean-fuel requirements, forcing other refiners to pay simply for abiding by state's rules (S)

headline.main: Court Might Review a Unocal Patent
